projects.title: Ridesharing web app
projects.subtitle: Best nonprofit hack co-winner at HackDuke: Code for Good 2019
text: Serving a local nonprofit’s ridesharing needs. Includes navigation, interactive map and Uber-like matching platform.
This app was requested by and built for Reality Ministries, which serves developmentally disabled adults.

projects.title: Describing the NIH-funded research workforce
projects.subtitle: Fellowship at National Institutes of Health
text: Led project to characterize scientists funded by the NIH, using machine-learning techniques. Results may help inform Congress and automate future analyses.
I worked through Coding It Forward as a 2019 Civic Digital Fellow.

projects.title: A new hypothesis for cancer formation
projects.subtitle: Research project at Duke Center for Genomic and Computational Biology
text: Analyzing genome data to confirm if transcription factor binding prevents repair enzymes from accessing damaged DNA, causing mutations.
I am working under Prof. Raluca Gordân in her lab.
